page.title: 05RIDING SCHOOL.
page.content: RIDING SCHOOL. Mr and Mrs Tuck have kept the North Lizard Riding School for 11 years. It has been a riding school for at least 40 years and was originally used for barning N.C.B. pit ponies. The Tucks have 32 horses ( 16 liveried ) of 9 different breeds including 4 pure bred fell ponies. An hour lesson costs Â£3.50 or Â£3.00 if booked in advance. The Tucks employ 2 full time staff and several voluntary helpers. Their licence must be renewed every year following inspections by the environmental officer and the vet. Although there are not so many riders in winter,the staff have more work to do.Horses are kept inside at night, fed,watered and taken out to the field.In summer,horses are kept in the field but must be regularly checked.
